info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 5:33PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Rawlins, northwestern Decatur, southwestern Red Willow and southeastern Hitchcock Counties through 630 PM CDT... At 533 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles northeast of Herndon, or 13 miles northwest of Oberlin, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 55 mph and dangerous cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Rawlins, northwestern Decatur, southwestern Red Willow and southeastern Hitchcock Counties, including the following locations... Traer and Cedar Bluffs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
